title: Device
description: A device’s properties and their values.

device_assigned_by.description: The email of the person who assigned the device.

device_assigned_date.description: A time stamp in ISO 8601 format that indicates when the device was assigned to the MDM server.

device_family.description: The device’s Apple product family: `iPad`, `iPhone`, `iPod`, `Mac`, `AppleTV`, or `Vision`. This key is valid in X-Server-Protocol-Version 2 and later.

mdm_migration_deadline.description: A time stamp in ISO 8601 format that indicates the MDM migration deadline. This key is valid with X-Server-Protocol-Version 8 and later.

op_date.description: A time stamp in ISO 8601 format that indicates when the device was added, updated, or deleted. If the value of `op_type` is added, this is the same as `device_assigned_date`. This field is only applicable with the [Sync the List of Devices](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/devicemanagement/sync-devices) command.

op_type.description: Indicates whether the device was added (assigned to the MDM server), modified, or deleted. Contains one of the following strings: `added`, `modified`, or `deleted`.This field is only applicable with the `sync the list of devices` command.

os.description:
The device’s operating system: `iOS`, `iPadOS`, `OSX`, `tvOS`, or `visionOS`.
This key is valid in X-Server-Protocol-Version 2 and later.
With X-Server-Protocol-Version 7 and later, iPad product os will return `iPadOS`.

profile_assign_time.description: A time stamp in ISO 8601 format that indicates when a profile was assigned to the device.

profile_push_time.description: A time stamp in ISO 8601 format that indicates when a profile was pushed to the device.

profile_status.description: The status of profile installation—either `empty`, `assigned`, `pushed`, or `removed`.

profile_uuid.description: The unique ID of the assigned profile.

response_status.$comment: Undocumented property returned only for the `Device Details` endpoint.
